sentences: Dino Jelusić (born 4 June 1992), also known by his stage name Dino Jelusick, is a Croatian rock singer, musician, and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: He is the founder, principal songwriter, and lead singer of progressive rock band Animal Drive, which was formed in 2012, and since 2017 has been signed to Frontiers Records.
section: N/A

sentences: Besides working on several hard rock and metal projects, since 2016, Jelusick has been a touring member for American rock band Trans-Siberian Orchestra.
section: N/A

sentences: He has also worked with Gus G., Mike Mangini, George Lynch, Will Hunt, Jeff Scott Soto, Steve Smyth, Jon Oliva, Kip Winger, John Macaluso, Deen Castronovo, Phil Demmel, and others.

sentences: He was the winner of the inaugural edition of the Junior Eurovision Song Contest in 2003.

sentences: As his parents also played musical instruments, Jelusick was introduced to music and singing at the age of three, and started performing at the age of five by appearing on television, on stages, and festivals.

section: == Career == | === 1997–2005: First musical efforts and Junior Eurovision Song Contest ===

sentences: In 2003, he participated in the first Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2003 in Denmark with a song he wrote at the age of ten, "Ti si moja prva ljubav", and won with 134 points.
section: == Career == | === 1997–2005: First musical efforts and Junior Eurovision Song Contest ===

sentences: Jelusick released his debut solo album, No. 1, in 2003, and an English version in 2004.
section: == Career == | === 1997–2005: First musical efforts and Junior Eurovision Song Contest ===

sentences: He toured the United States, Scandinavia, and Australia until 2005, and the tour included four large concerts in Denmark with a total audience of 100,000 people.

sentences: The same year, Jelusick became the youngest nominee of the Croatian music award Porin, at the age of twelve.
